title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a new 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer, in the 'default value' field, if an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', is entered, the invalid value is accepted. The following definition shows up in the report design:<parameters><scalarparameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType'>dateTime</property><property name='allowBlank'>false</property><property name='format'>Unformatted</property><property name='controlType'>textbox</property><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalarparameter></parameters>
EB: When creating a new 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the 'default value' field, such as '55/66/9999', the system should reject the invalid value and display an error message. The report design should not include the invalid value in the parameter definition.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Add a new 'DateTime' type parameter.
4. In the 'default value' field of the parameter, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
5. Save the report.
6. Validate that the system rejects the invalid date value and displays an error message.
7. Verify that the report design does not include the invalid value in the parameter definition.
